page.title: 02HOLY TRINITY PRIMARY SCHOOL<
page.content: On the edge of Hattersley is our Primary School. It has been on this site just below Holy Trinity Church in Higham Lane, Gee Cross, since 1858. The school was used for worship too until the church was built in 1874. We still have the original three classrooms which the younger children still use. The additional classrooms are used by the Juniors. We used to have to go outside to the toilet. This was terrible when it was raining or snowing. Now we have indoor toilets and these are much better. We learn more by research and discussion now and we have the use of a computer. We work with graphs, Venn Diagrams and in metres,kilometres,grams kilograms,millilitres and litres instead of the old measures.
